result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Miramontes III

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Angel Miramontes III not in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Angel Miramontes III.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Defendant was to appear via zoom today but did not long on. 
Atty Dolan indicates she sent the zoom information this morning and is not sure if her client has gotten them or not, requests warrant be stayed until a plea date. 
State has no objection. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defense indicates they would like another status to see what happens in another one of the defendant's cases. 
BTC: Matter set over.

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angel Miramontes III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Angel Miramontes III. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
